captions.text:
I stayed home alone everyday
My dad is a taxi driver

When I ask him where he is
He always said Yanghwa BRDG

In the mornings there would be
Candies and cookies by my pillow

I remember the young me waiting
for father who comes back at dawn

Father, mother, two sisters
I'm the youngest one, cutest

I remember me from those days
I remember

Let's be happy
Let us be happy

Let's not get sick, not get sick
Let's be happy, happy

Let's not get sick
Right, right?

Now I earn money, earn all money
I used ask for 100 won to my mother

Now my mother, father and
Even my dog looks up to me

My phone is ringing, 
It's my mother

Ring ring ring, How are you son
She asks me where I am

I say I'm at Yanghwa BRDG
Yanghwa BRDG
Mother let's be happy

Let's not get sick, not get sick
Let's be happy, happy

Let's not get sick
Right, right?

At that time, when I was young
I didn't know anything

I didn't know the feelings of
crossing that bridge

I'd ask where he is
ask him and he always said

'Yanghwa BRDG, Yanghwa BRDG'
Now I'm standing on the bridge

Let's be happy
Let us be happy

Let's not get sick, not get sick
Let's be happy, happy

Let's not get sick
Right, right?

Let's be happy, happy
Let's not get sick, not get sick

Let's be happy, happy
Let's not get sick, not get sick

comments.text:
This song seriously made me cry and remember everytime i waited and worried 
for dad in the cold nights to come back home,and how my mother worries and 
call me every hour ! I felt happy someone understands.﻿
comments.author: Lee Sol

comments.text:
우리 집에는 
매일 나 홀로 있었지
아버지는 택시드라이버
어디냐고 여쭤보면 항상 
"양화대교"
아침이면 머리맡에 놓인 
별사탕에 라면땅에
새벽마다 퇴근하신 아버지 
주머니를 기다리던
어린 날의 나를 기억하네
엄마 아빠 두 누나
나는 막둥이, 귀염둥이
그 날의 나를 기억하네 
기억하네 

행복하자 
우리 행복하자 
아프지 말고 아프지 말고
행복하자 행복하자
아프지 말고 그래 그래

내가 돈을 버네, 돈을 다 버네
"엄마 백원만" 했었는데
우리 엄마 아빠, 또 강아지도
이젠 나를 바라보네
전화가 오네, 내 어머니네
뚜루루루 "아들 잘 지내니"
어디냐고 물어보는 말에 
나 양화대교 "양화대교"

엄마 행복하자
아프지 말고 좀 아프지 말고
행복하자 행복하자
아프지 말고 그래 그래

그 때는 나 어릴 때는
아무것도 몰랐네
그 다리 위를 건너가는 기분을
어디시냐고 어디냐고
여쭤보면 아버지는 항상
양화대교, 양화대교
이제 나는 서있네 그 다리 위에

행복하자 
우리 행복하자 
아프지 말고 아프지 말고
행복하자 행복하자
아프지 말고 그래

행복하자 행복하자
아프지 말고 아프지 말고
행복하자 행복하자
아프지 말고 그래 그래﻿

comments.author: 박창준

comments.text:
This...this video hit me on the spot. At first I liked it because it 
sounded so good and I liked playing it while drawing. But one day I 
actually watched the video and read the lyrics. It was so emotional and 
relatable. My dad worked as a taxi-driver for several years now and would 
always come 4-5am and start again at 10am. He would answer "for you and 
your sister" when i asked why he pushed himself so hard T___T﻿

comments.text:
The music's amazing, his voice is amazing, the back-up instruments were

comments.author: tubbykids00

comments.text:
I've listened to this song many times, but only today I've read the lyrics 
properly (from the beginning to the end) and with just the first few verses 
I knew what was the meaning of the story he tells through his music. I know 
because, as Zion. T tells his story, he talks about so many of us and an 
emotion shared by every son and daughter. 
It was maybe fate for me to listen to this song today, like I needed it... 
it's no wonder I've started crying while listening and reading the lyrics. 
I missed home and family and I know exactly what he meant, what it is to 
grow up and realize you're an adult, you are now in your father's shoes.
Zion. T is able to reach many people with his songs, voice, stories, and 
I'm grateful he does it so wonderfully... thank you for your music.﻿

comments.author: asdfghjklzxcvbnm

comments.text:
<lyrics translation>

 
I used to be home alone all day long.
My father was a taxi driver.
When I ask where he at,
He says “Yangwha Bridge”
Some star-shaped candies and snacks underneath my head
I remember me in the childhood waiting for my father’s pocket, who always 
back home in the early morning from work.
Mom, Dad, Two sisters
I am the youngest, the baby of our family.
I remember me in those days.
I remember.

Let’s be happy, Let’s be happy together.
Not sick, Not being sick.
Let’s be happy, Let’s be happy.
Not sick, yes.

I earn money, I’ve become old enough to make money.
I used to say my mom, “Mom, 10 sent plz.”
My mom, dad and even our puppy now see me.
Bell is ringing, it’s my mom.
r-r-ring “Son, how are you?”
I answer my mom, “I’m Yangwha Bridge, Yangwha Bridge now”

Mom, Let’s be happy.
Don’t be sick, please don’t be sick.
Let’s be happy, Let’s be happy.
Not sick, yes.

I didn’t know anything when I was young.
Didn’t know the feeling of crossing over the bridge.
When I asked my father where he at, where he was.
He always answered, "Yangwha Bridge". Yangwha Bridge.
Now I stand on that very bridge.

Let’s be happy.
Let’s be happy together.
Not sick, Not being sick.
Let’s be happy.
Let’s be happy.
Not sick, yes.
(X2)﻿

comments.text:
The first time I watched this mv and understood the lyrics,so much regrets 
pop up to my mind. After that I almost cry every time when I listen to this 
song. I thought of my father used to work in bank, he had to visit clients 
in person, roaming in the city and coming home late. Sometimes he had to go 
to business dinner and drink alcohol, after he came home I smelled the 
alcohol, I said "you are so stinky" and just ran away, never want to stay 
with him. Now I am going to work in a bank too, thinking of my father and 
crying...﻿

comments.text:
This song really hits home for me. Having a father who is the only 
breadwinner in the family, and he recently had to start dialysis. "Let's be 
happy, let's not get sick" is almost the exact words I say in my everyday 
prayer. Kudos to Zion T for being able to sing with words so sincere in 
this world where sex seems to always sell. Mad respect.﻿
